phrases: watashi ga umareta asa no machi yuki no naka ni umoreta

sanagara mukashi kara yoku shiru tonari no ano ko no you ni
katahou no mimitabu de kiku sotsugyou no canon
hitori demo daijoubu yo tte mekureteru watashi no story
dareka no sei ni shitai yo
tsurai naa iya iya
kanashikutte naite bakkari itara me ga tokete nakunatta
aki ni nari mata fuyu ni nari hitotsu toshi wo totta
tooku made nigete iru tsumori demo owaranai kimi no story
niya niya waratte iru
fugainaiya iya
sugari nagara oikakete mitemo ashige ni saretemo
aita ana wo fusagou
chigai nai ya iya
fugainai ya iya
tsurai naa iya iya
My hometown lay buried in snow the morning I was born.
I looked up at the blue sky with my tiny hands.
The face of the girl next door that I have known so well...
It is as familiar as the graduation canon.
Thriving in solitude has been mistaken as my life story.
I want to blame it on someone.
It is so difficult.
No, I hate it.
Tears and sorrow caused me to miss my chance.
Autumn passed, winter came again, and I became a year older.
You think you have run far away, but your story never ends.
And yet, you are smirking.
It is so cowardly.
I hate it.
Even if I have to cling to you, chase after you, and get kicked down...
It is so cowardly.
No...
It is so difficult.
I hate it.
I hate it.
Kaoru disappeared on the day the year's first snow fell on the gray city.
I should have realized somewhere along the line...
But...
I just could not change the flow of events...
Let us go somewhere warm for a while.
Let us eat some good food, stare out at the ocean, and relax.
No way.
I can tell... you...
You look like you are thinking, Ah, I am finally free of my responsibilities.
Am I right?
You tagged along with me because you had to.
Even though you disobeyed Dad's instructions...
Dad said it, did not he?
To head towards the light.
You could see it, could not you?
But I could not see the light.
I could not even tell where it was coming from.
It is impossible.
There is no point in being told by someone talented like you.
I do not have anything.
Dad only cared about you until the very end...
I wonder what it would have been like, to be like you...
Shiroyama-san, I... Was I mistaken?
Exacting revenge is not suited for someone with imagination.
Besides, Kaoru-sama is kind to a fault.
He receives back all the damage he gives.
If something were to happen to Kaoru, I...
It is all right.
Did not I just say it?
Kaoru-sama has a gifted imagination.
On top of that, he is very smart and has an annoyingly sharp memory.
Like I said, when we ate natto together at Shiroyama's parents' house!
The combinations of Matsuda-san's efforts all these years in Chicago...
All the effort we put forth for the past twenty years...
And above all, the image of you, who loved and stayed with him for all these years...
Sorry, can you leave her alone for a while?
Is she not feeling well?
Well, actually...
Hagu!
Hagu, does it hurt?
Do you want to take some painkillers?
It is okay, I can handle it.
If I take them, I will not be able to tell.
If the pain does not come back to my hand, it means that my nerves have not reconnected, right?
In that case, I need to go back to surgery as soon as possible, right?
That is why, for now...
Hagu-chan...
S-Shuu-chan...
S-Shuu-chan...
What is the matter, Hagu?
It is back...
The pain...
It is here.
My hand... it is all right.
It is connected.
My hand...
I am so glad...
Hagu!
Hagu-chan!
So, she has not slept at all since then?
Yeah, I have told Hagu everything.
I also had the doctor give her an overview.
If the nerves do not reconnect...
That is why Hagu was desperately searching...
Just to feel the sensation from her right hand...
She rejected all painkillers and stabilizers...
She even refused to sleep...
All so she can keep searching in the darkness.
Hagu-chan is amazing...
To be honest...
Both Yamada-san and I were overwhelmed...
From this point on is the crucial stage.
Everything after this will depend on her rehabilitation.
Knowing Hagu, she will never give up until she regains movement.
There are apparently cases where rehab will not bring back sensation to your fingers.
Whether she will be able to draw with a brush like before...
She might have to live with numbness and other sensory disabilities for the rest of her life.
Her efforts alone may not be enough.
But if she does not try, she will lose it all for sure.
God, please save her...
What is this?
You are finally getting a cellphone, Yamada-san?
Nomiya-san...
I see.
So you were looking at cellphones...
I want to be able to help out in any way possible...
But I honestly do not know.
Is there really anything someone like me could do for her?
This might sound cliche, but I truly realized that we live in different worlds.
Yeah, that is true.
Everyone probably thinks that.
And everyone will distance themselves from her...
All saying, There probably is not anything I can do for her.
And before you know it, she is all alone.
She is probably stressed out right now on whether or not her hand will move again...
Yamada-san, you should stay.
You need to stay with her.
You are her friend, are not you?
Yeah.
Thank you, Nomiya-san.
Sheesh... what a troublesome girl.
Oh, crap, they heard me!
YOU-Um... well..
I was saying something childish like You are her friend, are not you?...
What I meant was...
They will never let me live this down as long as I live...
Nomiya, good job!
Ah, Miwako-san.
Please do not cry!
Huh?
Friends, huh?
It gets me every time...
Just hearing it brings tears to my eyes.
I can sympathize.
When you are our age, a lot of things become more complicated.
All your friends start to become estranged...
That is not true!
I am here for you, Yamazaki!
M-Miwako-san!
We will be friends forever!
It is all right
Friends forever!
Oh no, Yamazaki-san!
We are going to prove that there are friendships that stand the test of adulthood!
Oh, this is fun stuff!
Ruff!
S-S-Sis, please stop already...
Friends!
Friends!
I would always felt it.
Even though she would be in front of me, it felt like she was looking into a different world.
She is here now, but someday she will float far away.
But...
You are her friend, are not you?
Hagu-chan!
Ayu...
How is it?
It is a little too lumpy, I guess.
It is warm.
It is so that your back and shoulders will not get cold when you sit up.
It is got down in it, so it is light, huh?
Let us make you a better pillow to rest your arm on, too.
You could use a cuter one.
Oh, and I brought some grapes as well.
The Red Grove, the non-peel kind that you like.
Um, there is that, books, and MDs...
Ayu, you have a feather in your hair.
On your sweater, too.
Oh, man!
I thought I got them all before I left home.
Actually, I made that cape using my Dad's old down jacket.
The room got filled with feathers, it was such a mess!
I just cut right into it with scissors, and the down all came flying out.
It was so bad, it took me two hours to clean up.
Ayu, there is a bunch more on your back.
Aw... man, no way!
Can you get them off?
Oh, why me?
You do not need to get them off.
Hagu-chan?
I mean...
I mean, you look just like an angel.
Thank you.
Thank you, Ayu.
I will come again at 2 P.M. tomorrow.
Thank you very much, Dr. Satsuki.
The shock seems to have been a little too much.
Yes...
Hanamoto-san?
Hanamoto-san?
Are you listening, Hanamoto-san?
Oh, yes.
Hagumi-san's upper body is getting stiff.
Like I mentioned yesterday, please massage her shoulders and upper arm, taking care to avoid her wound.
All you have to do is gently give her a rub.
The aim here is to get her to relax.
Let us take things steadily and optimistically.
Yes.
Thank you very much.
E-Expensive...
Flowers sure are expensive...
This little thing is 300 yen?
If 1,000 yen will only get me three...
Takemoto-kun...
Y-Yamada-san!
For Hagu-chan?
Ah, well, I thought flowers might be nice...
But...
Takemoto-kun...
Want To go somewhere nice?
Yamada-san, is this that somewhere nice?
Yep, this is it.
There are plenty of flowers here!
You can pick all you want!
We will tell her that we picked them ourselves!
I am sure she will be happier that way.
All right!
Here you go, Hagu-chan.
I am so happy.
They are freshly picked.
We got them on the embankment by the train tracks.
The stonecrop was actually the biggest and cutest, but it had too much pollen, so we skipped it.
Hagu-chan?
No way...
She does not have any sensation...
In her fingertips?
Can such a thing...
Her rehab has just began.
Plus, I hear that there are many who started where Hagu is and ultimately regained the sensation in their fingers.
But...
Yamada-san, there is no rushing or giving up.
That applies to the three of us as well.
If the people watching over start to waver, the person who is drowning will not have anyone to grab onto.
So with that said, let us all set our own bases...
Are not you supposed to man the store on Wednesdays?!
And Takemoto!
Get cracking on your senior thesis!
Have not you two been coming every day lately?
I am thankful, but you cannot neglect your personal lives.
Sensei...
What is it?
The person who was here last night...
Was that Hagu-chan's father?
That is right.
I could tell from what I saw last night and Sensei's expression just now.
I see...
That the place she was supposed to be able to return to is not the same anymore.
I know.
It is not anyone's fault.
We are all just trying our best to live our lives.
But God, why must all of this happen at once?
At this rate, she will not be able to take much more.
She...
Bruises that looked like red flowers started appearing on Hagu-chan's left hand.
The stress is causing her to bite herself.
But after a while, those bruises moved to Sensei's wrist.
The person who is drowning will not have anyone to grab onto.
Sensei was so composed, it was scary.
For Hagu-chan's sake, he must have sworn not to waver no matter what.
I got a fax from Shin-san yesterday.
To Takemoto-kun: Greetings, we are now working in Morioka.
Regarding your job, we would like for you to join us around mid-April.
Their new work is in Morioka, and they would like me to join them by mid-April.
The day for us to part is drawing ever closer.
Are we really just going to drift apart?
Am I going to leave her while she is like this?
I should forget about Morioka and stay in Tokyo.
Or not.
What am I thinking?
What am I going to do if I do not take this job?
What is a life for?
Is not it so you can be there to tightly grip the hand of someone close to you at a time like this?
That is right.
I should quit and stay by her side.
I can encourage her through rehab.
To make time to care for her, I can just choose a part-time job that allows me a flexible schedule.
Like a janitor, road construction worker, or late-night convenience stock clerk.
But wait...
Could I live alone in Tokyo on an income like that?
Right now, I am living off of money sent from home and my part-time job.
It is obvious, but I will have to become independent once I graduate.
No, I will be all right if I work as much as possible.
I can make a living if I am not wasteful.
But... if I work that much, I will not have the time to care for Hagu-chan.
And in the first place, what am I going to do once she gets better?
What if, after my family helped put me through this expensive art school...
If that were to happen, would not my very existence be a burden to her?
hajime kara sono tsumori de kimi wa ita no kamo nante
You never were in love with me to begin with, I think...
I though back to Mayama-san's words...
If something were to happen to the woman I love...
sore nara sore de betsu ni ii ya I do not really care when I think about it.
i am about to sara tashikame you mo nai It is not like I can go back and check.
I have just now become truly aware of the meaning behind those words.
A man who cannot even buy a tiny flower like that cannot possibly save a girl whom he loves.
dare wo nikundara ii Who am I supposed to hate?
I am making excuses to substitute for the real problem.
nani wo oshikoroseba ii What emotions am I supposed to hold back?
I say that I want to save her, but in reality, I just do not want to be apart from her.
te wo furazu ni satte iku hou wa boku yori kanashii no kanaa Was the person who left without a goodbye the sadder of the two?
nee i am about to boku no mune wa haritsumete shimau bakari de Hey, all my heart can do now is hurt.
tada namida dake ga darashi naku ochiru no desu I am just crying here pathetically.
kanashimi wa nami no you ni nando mo kurikaesurashii I hear sorrow repeats over and over like the waves.
warui tsume wo hagu toki mitai ni itsuka yukkuri hagarete iku no kanaa I wonder if it will grow out on its own like a damaged fingernail?
arifurete iru kimochi nante sa
It would be so much easier...
nanimo iwazu ni isso kieteshimaeba
raku ni nareru no ni
sorezore no michi wo yuku sono wakaremichi
At the crossroads where we split ways...
mou nidoto au koto no nai deai wa kanashisugiru
tarinai kimochi wo mochiyotte
Despite adding the emotions that are lacking...
atatameta saki kara hieteitte
sonna hazu naitte shinjiteru
ittai itsumade onaji kotoba wo kakaekondenda
Just how long am I going to brood over the same word?
kakekondenda
How long...?
